info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 3:54AM PST until January 12 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting to 30 mph and locally up to 50 mph over mountains. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4500 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible with higher amounts up to around 15 inches over higher mountains. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph over mountains. * WHERE...The Winter Weather advisory includes Highway 97 in northern Klamath County, Chemult, Crescent and higher mountains in eastern Klamath and western Lake Counties. The Winter Storm Watch includes Chemult, Crescent, and higher terrain in northern and eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County above 4500 feet. This also includes Highway 97 in northern Klamath County, and higher portions of highways 140 and 31. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 4 PM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
